creator: henning.blohm@web.de
text:
Since Tomcat3.3m1 and up to Tomcat3.3m3 the path info of a servlet url seems to 
get unescaped until there is no more escaped character (i.e. no more "%"). This 
has not been the case in previous versions. This behavior effectively prevents 
to put non predictable data in the path info. 
We are currently developing a web application framework that actively makes use 
of storing some parameters in the path info of generated URLs. The described 
bug leads to unpredictable results when parsing the path info.

Regards,
  Henning Blohm

creator: henning.blohm@web.de
text:
ok, I cam to the conclusion that this and similar behavoir appears in other web 
containers as well. So I will take refuge in using some own encoding. Please 
close this bug, since it doesn't seem to be one.

Thank you,
  Henning

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I think this was fixed in M4 and future - the % is decoded only once during
processing.
I don't know about other containers, it's a difficult issue.
BTW, we also fixed the request URI to return un-encoded strings, so you may use
it as well.
